column1: 3B698127-15E2-4610-8840-E11D69BBAE94#appfire#679F0F0F-C1F8-4FE8-BA99-BDB60CDA8829#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 15:22:29.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 15:22:29.0#appfire#1

column1: E0F61045-4922-425D-A6FC-925970532062#appfire#679F0F0F-C1F8-4FE8-BA99-BDB60CDA8829#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 15:22:29.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 15:22:29.0#appfire#1
